page.title: 04SURVEY 1871/1985,BROMPTON(2)
page.content: {71%}of the population in 1985 were born in Yorkshire. Looking back over other census data it was the coming of the railway to Brompton which began to bring other people into the community from away. In 1871 an amazing{88%}of the employed population were farm labourers or servants. Other jobs were connected to life in a feudal village e.g. grooms, dressmakers, blacksmiths, joiners,footmen etc. By loking at the population in 1871 we saw that Brompton was a self-contained farming community. Nowadays farming is still important but only{6%}of people work on farms, not so many people are needed now to run big farms.The single biggest occupation now is schoolteachers{10%!} _but the sample returns for 1985 were much less than in 1871.
